revised_title: Self-Acting Apparatus for Multiplying and Maintaining Electric Charges
tldr: The author describes a self-acting apparatus for multiplying and maintaining electric charges, using water-dropping collectors and Leyden jars. The apparatus demonstrates the principles of electrostatics and has applications in illustrating the Voltaic Theory. The author also discusses the potential and limitations of the device, as well as its similarities to self-sustaining electromagnetic systems.
